p: To determine if interferon signaling plays a role, we co-treated cells with SR9009 and ruxolitinib, a Jak inhibitor that efficiently suppresses the interferon signaling pathway, and found no difference in viral titer even at conditions that prevented ISG15 induction ( Supplementary Figure 5). We also rule out failure to cleave the polyprotein as a potential mechanism, as there was no accumulation of higherâ€“molecular weight E2E1 protein, and degradation is most likely not the cause of the phenotype, as MG132 (proteasome inhibitor), NMS-873 (ERAD inhibitor), and bafilomycin A (autophagy inhibitor) failed to rescue the levels ( Supplementary Figure 6). Moreover, SR9009 does not markedly affect the synthesis of VSV proteins ( Supplementary Figure 7). Thus, SR9009 preferentially blocks CHIKV translation.
